timeline.message: Update notebooks.yaml to latest Leonardo and remove deprecated CLusterRequest fields
Specify Welder image and pull Jupyter and Welder from dockerhub

timeline.bodyText:
Version 0.0.8 is the first to be published to Dockerhub
By default Welder is pulled from GCR, so we need to be explicit
timeline.author: jmthibault79

timeline.bodyText: jupyterDockerImage is deprecated and toolDockerImage replaces it
timeline.author: jmthibault79
jmthibault79
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1375,14 +1375,6 @@ definitions:
       userJupyterExtensionConfig:
         $ref: "#/definitions/UserJupyterExtensionConfig"
         description: Jupyter extensions to be installed in the notebook
-      jupyterExtensionUri:

timeline.bodyText:
Also deprecated in the Leo yaml
toolDockerImage and below: copy/paste update from Leo swagger yaml
timeline.author: jmthibault79
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1426,9 +1418,14 @@ definitions:
       defaultClientId:
         type: string
         description: The default Google Client ID.
-      jupyterDockerImage:

timeline.bodyText:
This seems less descriptive than previously, although does align with Leo's. Ours appears to have always been different than Leo's in this case (looking at history).
I'd probably prefer to keep our more descriptive description and PR Leo with the updated one? Was there a reason to update this, or was it just copying their most recent swagger?
timeline.author: s-rubenstein
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -1442,10 +1439,7 @@ definitions:
         default: false
       customClusterEnvironmentVariables:
         type: object
-        description: A collection of key/value pairs of environment variable names and their desired value to be set in the cluster.
-        additionalProperties:
-          type: string
-
+        description: Optional environment variables to be set on the cluster.

replies.bodyText: This was strictly a copy.  We can go the other way.
replies.author: jmthibault79

replies.bodyText: Okay, I'd leave our old description around then on this one, and PR leo with that. (Mainly because it seems mostly unrelated to the change here.)
replies.author: s-rubenstein
